title: 110_s3611
content:
The Act is titled the "Medicaid Services Restoration Act of 2008" and includes a table of contents. It also addresses rehabilitative services protections in Title I. TITLE I--REHABILITATIVE SERVICES PROTECTIONS
Sec. 101. Therapeutic foster care included in medical assistance.
Sec. 102. Payment methodologies for rehabilitative services.
Sec. 103. Attainment and retention of functional status in rehabilitative services.
Sec. 104. Coverage of EPSDT services for children in psychiatric hospitals clarified.
Sec. 105. Third party liability clarification for diagnostic, screening, preventive, and rehabilitative services.
Sec. 106. Effective date. Sec. 201-206 clarify third party liability, payment methodologies, health and safety protection, Olmstead standard codification, and appropriate case management. Effective date specified. Section 1905 of the Social Security Act is amended to include therapeutic foster care services for children under 21 with mental illness or developmental disabilities. Therapeutic foster care programs provide structured daily activities, crisis intervention, medication monitoring, counseling, and specialized training for foster care parents to care for children with mental illness or developmental disabilities in a community setting. Therapeutic foster care programs offer specialized services for children with mental illness, emotional or behavioral disorders, medically fragile conditions, or developmental disabilities. Services do not include room and board for children in State custody or receiving foster care maintenance payments. The Social Security Act is being amended to establish reasonable and efficient payment methodologies for rehabilitative services, including fee-for-service payments, case rates, daily rates, or other forms of capitated payment. Additionally, the Act now includes attainment and retention of functional status in rehabilitative services, in addition to restoration to the best possible functional level. SEC. 104 amends the Social Security Act to clarify coverage of EPSDT services for children receiving inpatient psychiatric hospital services. SEC. 105 clarifies third party liability relating to diagnostic, screening, preventive, and rehabilitative services. Section 1903(c) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow payment for medical assistance for services provided under section 1905(a)(13) to eligible individuals by qualified providers under non-medical programs. The amendments made by this title shall take effect as if enacted on July 1, 2008. Section 1903(c) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow payment for medical assistance for services provided under section 1915(g) to eligible individuals by qualified providers under non-medical programs. Additionally, a State or local agency administering such plan must comply with section 1902(a)(25). Section 1915(g)(4) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow reimbursement for case management and targeted case management services through various payment methodologies. Additionally, there is a provision for protecting health and safety. SEC. 203 amends the Social Security Act to allow states to require case management services for beneficiaries to ensure health and welfare. SEC. 204 codifies the Olmstead standard and focuses on protecting children. Section 1915(g)(2)(A) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow for services to assist individuals in gaining access to necessary medical, social, educational, and other services in a community setting. Qualified providers under the State plan can offer these services, distinct from direct services of non-medical programs. For case management services, individuals transitioning to a community setting for up to 180 days at the end of an institutional stay can be considered, excluding certain age groups and inmates. SEC. 205. ASSURING APPROPRIATE CASE MANAGEMENT.

Amendment allows states to provide case management services through multiple case managers to individuals qualifying for medical assistance under the State plan.

SEC. 206. EFFECTIVE DATE.

Amendments take effect as if enacted on December 4, 2007.
